body_html:
Thank you for the diff, it's helpful. Putting comments from that diff here:

  • Do we have a plan for keeping our copy of distutils synced with upstream?
  • I notice there are a number of gratuitous, non-substantive changes in the diff; for example, change of [self.mc, '-h', h_dir, '-r', rc_dir, src] to [self.mc] + ['-h', h_dir, '-r', rc_dir] + [src]. On the one hand, I don't really care (as far as the code goes); OTOH, gratuitous changes make syncing with upstream harder.

It does seem to me that you might be able to replace all of the copy-pasted code with a monkeypatch of spawn. I'm not sure if this is better or worse; what do you think?

body:
Thank you for the diff, it's helpful. Putting comments from that diff here:

- Do we have a plan for keeping our copy of distutils synced with upstream?
- I notice there are a number of gratuitous, non-substantive changes in the diff; for example, change of `[self.mc, '-h', h_dir, '-r', rc_dir, src]` to `[self.mc] + ['-h', h_dir, '-r', rc_dir] + [src]`. On the one hand, I don't really care (as far as the code goes); OTOH, gratuitous changes make syncing with upstream harder.

It does seem to me that you might be able to replace all of the copy-pasted code with a monkeypatch of spawn. I'm not sure if this is better or worse; what do you think?
